contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement |name = Swalmen |image_flag = Swalmen flag 450.png |image_shield = Coat of arms of Swalmen.gif |image_map = LocatieSwalmen.png |subdivision_type = [[List of sovereign states|Country]] |subdivision_name = [[Netherlands]] |subdivision_type1 = Province |subdivision_name1 = Limburg |subdivision_type2 = Municipality |subdivision_name2 = Roermond |area_km2 = 22.96 |area_land_km2 = 21.54 |area_water_km2 = 1.42 |population = 8797 |population_as_of = 1 July 2006 |density = 408 |latitude = |longitude = |blank_name_sec1 = Transport |blank1_name_sec1 = Major roads |blank1_info_sec1 = [[Rijksweg 73|A 73]], [[Rijksweg 271|N 271]] |dialling_code = 0475 |postal_code = 6070-6071 |image = [[File:River Swalm.jpg|250px|De Swalm bij Swalmen]]<br/> Swalm brook near Swalmen }} '''Swalmen''' ({{Pronunciation|162 Swalmen.ogg}}, [[Limburgish]] and town dialect: ''Zjwame'') is a [[town]] in the south-eastern [[Netherlands]]. The town is situated between the [[Germany|German]] border and the [[Meuse River|Meuse]] river (''Maas'' in Dutch). Until 1 January 2007, Swalmen was a separate municipality, covering the villages Swalmen, [[Asselt]] and [[Boukoul]]. These are now part of the municipality of [[Roermond]]. Many monuments are found in Swalmen, most notable the [[Hillenraad castle]], the romanesque 'Rozenkerkje' church in [[Asselt]], and castle farms Graeterhof and Zuidewijk Spick. The area attracts tourists for its peaceful surroundings, asparagus, the ''Groenewoud'' forest and forestrial swimming pool [http://www.zwembaddebosberg.nl/ de Bosberg]. ==External links== *[http://www.swalmen.nl Official website] *[http://www.amicitiaboukoul.nl Website Harmonie Amicitia Boukoul] *[http://www.zwembaddebosberg.nl/ de Bosberg swimming pool website] {{Coord|51|14|N|6|02|E|region:NL_type:city|display=title}} [[Category:Populated places in Limburg (Netherlands)]] [[Category:Former municipalities of Limburg (Netherlands)]] [[Category:Roermond]] {{LimburgNL-geo-stub}}
